body_html:
@freedomtan I can hardly call it "mine" :). It's a standard TX1 environment, and TX1 is a very popular board.

It's very disheartening to see that the TensorFlow community enables support for aarch64 platforms only one platform at a time (notably, only Raspberry Pi is properly supported).

body:
@freedomtan I can hardly call it "mine" :). It's a standard TX1 environment, and TX1 is a very popular board. 

It's very disheartening to see that the TensorFlow community enables support for aarch64 platforms only one platform at a time (notably, only Raspberry Pi is properly supported).
